intro: Lithraea chichita, commonly known as the Chichita tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and deciduous leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its bark is thick and fibrous, often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Lithraea chichita is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
